carousel_items: Use one lozenge every 2 hours as you need to for sore throat.
Since the lozenges could be mistaken for candy and can be a choking hazard, keep these away from children who are younger than 5 years old.
If you experience any uncomfortable burning or stinging, stop using Cepacol lozenges.
Let your doctor know if you have an infection and your symptoms don’t get better after a few days.

basics.benefits_moa: Cepacol lozenges have two types of local anesthetics. Benzocaine creates a numbing sensation that relieves pain and menthol creates a cooling sensation that distracts you from feeling pain.
basics.bottom_line: Cepacol lozenges relieve sore throat pain and don't have many side effects.
downsides: These lozenges don’t cure infections or colds, but they help relieve some of their symptoms.
Pain relief doesn't last long, so use a new lozenge every 2 hours.
Can’t be used for children who are younger than 5 years old.

downsides_processed.orig: These lozenges don’t cure infections or colds, but they help relieve some of their symptoms.
Pain relief doesn't last long, so use a new lozenge every 2 hours.
Can’t be used for children who are younger than 5 years old.

upsides: Cepacol lozenges are effective at relieving pain in the mouth and throat. They start working right away, so you don’t have to wait long to feel better.
Have two medicines in one lozenge that work in different ways to provide pain relief.
Comes in a sugar-free form.
Available in different flavors so you have the option of choosing the best-tasting one.

upsides_processed.orig: Cepacol lozenges are effective at relieving pain in the mouth and throat. They start working right away, so you don’t have to wait long to feel better.

carousel_items_processed.orig: Use one lozenge every 2 hours as you need to for sore throat.
Since the lozenges could be mistaken for candy and can be a choking hazard, keep these away from children who are younger than 6 years old.
If you experience any uncomfortable burning or stinging, stop using Chloraseptic Sore Throat Lozenges.

risks_warnings.title: Sore throat warning
risks_warnings.description: If your sore throat gets worse or you begin to have a high fever, headache, nausea, or vomiting, talk to your doctor since these could all be signs of a worsening infection.

description_processed.orig: If your sore throat gets worse or you begin to have a high fever, headache, nausea, or vomiting, talk to your doctor since these could all be signs of a worsening infection.

risks_warnings.title: Abnormal blood levels of methemoglobin (Methemoglobinemia)
risks_warnings.description: Chloraseptic Sore Throat Lozenges has been linked to methemoglobinemia, a very serious condition that occurs when there are high levels of methemoglobin in your blood. Too much methemoglobin leads to less oxygen that can be delivered to your tissues, and this can be life-threatening. This reaction’s very rare and mostly occurs in young children. Seek medical attention immediately if you start having symptoms such as a fast heartbeat, confusion, cyanosis (turning blue), dizziness, or trouble breathing.
risk_factors: Using Chloraseptic Sore Throat Lozenges at a higher dose and longer than recommended l History of smoking and breathing problems

description_processed.orig: Chloraseptic Sore Throat Lozenges has been linked to methemoglobinemia, a very serious condition that occurs when there are high levels of methemoglobin in your blood. Too much methemoglobin leads to less oxygen that can be delivered to your tissues, and this can be life-threatening. This reaction’s very rare and mostly occurs in young children. Seek medical attention immediately if you start having symptoms such as a fast heartbeat, confusion, cyanosis (turning blue), dizziness, or trouble breathing.

carousel_items: Only spray Chloraseptic spray on painful areas in your mouth. Let it sit for 15 seconds and then spit the liquid out.
Don't swallow Chloraseptic spray because it could upset your stomach.
Don’t use more than one spray every 2 hours.
If your mouth or throat still hurts after 2 days, it could be due to a worsening infection. Work with a doctor to find the best medication for you.

basics.benefits_moa: Chloraseptic spray is a local anesthetic. It blocks receptors on nerve endings, which creates a numbing sensation and relieves pain.
basics.bottom_line: Chloraseptic spray relieves sore throat pain and doesn't have many side effects.
downsides: It can stain your hair, nails, and skin.
It doesn’t cure throat or mouth infections.
Only lasts about 2 hours.

downsides_processed.orig: It can stain your hair, nails, and skin.
It doesn’t cure throat or mouth infections.
Only lasts about 2 hours.

upsides: Chloraseptic spray is effective at relieving pain in the mouth and throat. It starts working right away, so you don’t have to wait long to feel better.
It's available in a pharmacy without a prescription and comes in different flavors.
Chloraseptic spray is alcohol, sugar, and aspirin free, so it’s pretty safe to use.
If you buy the "max" throat spray, it contains an additional medication that forms a soothing film over your throat.

upsides_processed.orig: Chloraseptic spray is effective at relieving pain in the mouth and throat. It starts working right away, so you don’t have to wait long to feel better.
It's available in a pharmacy without a prescription and comes in different flavors.

If you buy the "max" throat spray, it contains an additional medication that forms a soothing film over your throat.

risks_warnings.title: Sore throat warning
risks_warnings.description: If your sore throat gets worse or you begin to have a high fever, headache, nausea, or vomiting, talk to your doctor since these could all be signs of a worsening infection.

description_processed.orig: If your sore throat gets worse or you begin to have a high fever, headache, nausea, or vomiting, talk to your doctor since these could all be signs of a worsening infection.

carousel_items: Use 1 to 2 lozenges every 2 hours as you need to for sore throat and cough.
Since the lozenges could be mistaken for candy and can be a choking hazard, keep these away from children who are younger than 6 years old.
If you experience any uncomfortable burning or stinging, stop using Chloraseptic Total Sore Throat and Cough Lozenges.
Let your doctor know if you have an infection and your symptoms don’t get better after a few days.

basics.benefits_moa: Chloraseptic Total Sore Throat and Cough Lozenges have three types of medication. Benzocaine creates a numbing sensation that relieves pain. Menthol creates a cooling sensation that distracts you from feeling pain. Dextromethorphan is a cough suppressant.
basics.bottom_line: Chloraseptic Total Sore Throat and Cough Lozenges relieve sore throat pain and cough well.
downsides: These lozenges don’t cure infections or colds, but they help relieve some of their symptoms.
Pain relief doesn't last long, so use a new lozenge every 2 hours as needed.
Can’t be used for children who are younger than 6 years old.
Can cause more side effects than other cough drops or lozenges since it has a cough suppressant in it.

downsides_processed.orig: These lozenges don’t cure infections or colds, but they help relieve some of their symptoms.
Pain relief doesn't last long, so use a new lozenge every 2 hours as needed.
Can’t be used for children who are younger than 6 years old.
Can cause more side effects than other cough drops or lozenges since it has a cough suppressant in it.

upsides: Chloraseptic Total Sore Throat and Cough Lozenges are effective at relieving pain in the mouth and throat. They start working right away, so you don’t have to wait long to feel better.
Have three medicines in one lozenge that work in different ways to provide pain and cough relief.
Comes in a sugar-free form.

upsides_processed.orig: Chloraseptic Total Sore Throat and Cough Lozenges are effective at relieving pain in the mouth and throat. They start working right away, so you don’t have to wait long to feel better.
Have three medicines in one lozenge that work in different ways to provide pain and cough relief.
Comes in a sugar-free form.

names_brand: Chloraseptic Total Sore Throat and Cough Lozenge

risks_warnings.title: Sore throat warning
risks_warnings.description: If your sore throat gets worse or you begin to have a high fever, headache, nausea, or vomiting, talk to your doctor since these could all be signs of a worsening infection.

description_processed.orig: If your sore throat gets worse or you begin to have a high fever, headache, nausea, or vomiting, talk to your doctor since these could all be signs of a worsening infection.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition when there's too much serotonin in the brain. The dextromethorphan in Chloraseptic Total Sore Throat and Cough Lozenges, when used with other medicines that affect serotonin (antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort), increases your risk for serotonin syndrome. Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have these symptoms.
risk_factors: Using other medications that affect serotonin

description_processed.orig: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition when there's too much serotonin in the brain. The dextromethorphan in Chloraseptic Total Sore Throat and Cough Lozenges, when used with other medicines that affect serotonin (antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort), increases your risk for serotonin syndrome. Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have these symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Abnormal blood levels of methemoglobin (Methemoglobinemia)
risks_warnings.description: Chloraseptic Total Sore Throat and Cough Lozenges has been linked to methemoglobinemia, a very serious condition that occurs when there are high levels of methemoglobin in your blood. Too much methemoglobin leads to less oxygen that can be delivered to your tissues, and this can be life-threatening. This reaction’s very rare and mostly occurs in young children. Seek medical attention immediately if you start having symptoms such as a fast heartbeat, confusion, cyanosis (turning blue), dizziness, or trouble breathing.
